details.dialog_text: Ugh! Gnolls are attacking me! Don't worry, I'll take 'em out.
Ye can help me out by clicking enemies. Ye don't do much damage, but every little bit helps.
Hey, why don't ye spend that gold ye've collected to level me up?
Aha! My damage is increased! Thank ye, friend!
Don't forget, ye can level me up to increase my damage!
There's no reason to be thrifty, friend! Spend more of ye gold to level me up more!
Ah! I've levelled up enough to earn an upgrade! Click it to apply it!
Hey, ye got an upgrade to apply! It don't cost anything, so get on with it!
Finally, this area's quest is complete! Click the arrow to move onto the next area!
Don't forget to click the arrow to move onto the next area!
Ye've got enough gold to recruit another Champion! Click here to recruit Celeste and she will join me in me fight against the gnolls!
Well met, Bruenor. Selûne shall guide us to victory.
That last upgrade I got gave me a formation ability! If ye move me closer to Celeste, or Celeste closer to me, it'll increase me damage!
Ah, I love fightin' beside me companions! Celeste has me all a-fired up to smash some heads and me damage has gone up!
Did ye know ye can increase the damage ye do when ye click? Just click here to increase ye click damage!
Look out! The monsters ahead are especially strong, and they're lead by a terrible boss monster!
Ah, that last upgrade you unlocked is my Ultimate Attack! You can choose when you use it by clicking this button on the bar. Ultimates have a short cooldown between uses, but are quite powerful!
Aha! Take that, Gnoll scum!
Aha! That boss dropped a chest! Chests contain gear, potions, and contracts. I'll explain those all later. For now, click up here to view your chest stash.
Ah, look at that shiny treasure chest! Go ahead and open it up by clickin' on it!
That chest ye just opened had some gear for me in it! Click on me portrait to view my character sheet!
Gear is automatically equipped when you get it!
Ye got some duplicate gear in that chest! Duplicate gear makes the item you already have in the slot more powerful!
Praise Moradin! I feel much more powerful! My damage is greatly increased!
Ugh, I must be off me game. Don't forget you can click on the gnolls to help me out!
A tough battle, but we'll regroup one area back and try again when we've leveled up some. Just click the next area arrow to push forward again. Moradin willing, we won't fail again.

Ye can choose which specialization you'd like this Champion to have. Different specializations unlock different upgrades in the future. Don't worry if ye don't know what to choose. Ye can change your Champion's specialization every time you do a new adventure.
Moradin's beard! There's too many gnolls to handle on our own! If ye save up 50 gold to recruit another Champion, they could really help us out!
Look out! That enemy's got a bow! Ranged enemies can attack from afar, but ye can click them to interrupt their attacks, if yer quick about it!

Ye've got a Champion on the bench who ain't helpin' our cause. Ye can click and drag 'em into yer formation if ye can find a spot where they'll be useful. There might not be enough room for all of us at once, though.
Did ye know ye can spend those gems ye've been gettin' from bosses? Click here to open the store and I'll show ye how.
Click here to select one silver chest.
And click here to purchase it!
Voila! Chests can contain gear, potions, and gold for our party. Ye can buy Gold Chests, too, if ye save up more gems.
Hey ye got a potion from a chest! Great! Potions can be used to buff everyone up temporarily. Ye can find them in the inventory here.
Oh, ye got a bounty contract! Ye can use those to instantly earn a boatload o' gold. You can find them in yer inventory here.

Ah ye lucky dog! Yer makin' an old dwarf very jealous. Ye got a shiny piece of gear! Shiny gear is super rare and more powerful than normal gear. Now that ye got a shiny in that equipment slot, all other gear in that slot will be shiny too.
Oh hey, ye've got some contracts as well. They can be found here, too.
Me last upgrade is another formation ability! It increases the damage of everyone in the same column as me. Can ye arrange yer formation to take advantage of that?
That upgrade ye just unlocked increased the whole party's damage! Keep an eye out for more upgrades like that. They're great!

Did ye know ye can turn on auto progress and we'll hurry on to the next area as soon as we're done the quest? Just click this button here to toggle it, and ye can just step back and let us do our thing.
Auto progress will turn off if we're defeated, so check back often ta level us up and get us movin' forward again.
Ye've got yerself a new Champion! Great! Ye don't have enough gold to unlock them quite yet, so I'll bug ye again when you do.

We've journeyed hard and completed the objective for this adventure. Now it's time to complete it and reset. For resetting, we'll earn the favor of Torm and earn more gold on our future adventures. Click here to do that.
Ah, the Sword Coast. Home. There's plenty to do, but first we have some unfinished business in that last adventure. Click here.
This here be an adventure variant! It's a twist on the base adventure that adds some extra challenge!

Look familiar, eh? Except for this blasted wagon. Don't fret, ye've earned some favor with Torm so we'll be collectin' more gold from every monster we kill. Ye'll be finished and resettin' again before ye can spit.
Ye may have noticed that the story has started again. Ye can keep going to earn more gold and favor, but the enemies will be harder this time around. Good luck!
Let me show ye how to swap in yer new Champion! Yer new champion is in this seat. Click to bring up the character sheet of the base Champion in the bench slot.
Click on the swap button to pick another hero to swap into this bench slot.
And click on the button next to yer new Champion to swap 'em in!

If ye just hit Swap, ye can now use yer new Champion. Every Champion has a specific bench slot they occupy, but ye can only have one Champion in each bench slot at a time. As you unlock more and more Champions, ye'll have to pick which one in each slot ye want to be usin'.
Hey! Ye just got an event token! Ye can use those to start event adventures and variants in the event campaign that's currently available! I'll tell ye more the next time you reset.

Hey, before ye start a new adventure, there's an event active! Events are temporary campaigns that last for a limited time and provide great rewards, like brand new Champions. Click here to view the event campaign.
During each event, a different deity watches over our party, so there's a new type of Divine Favor to collect. Don't be alarmed if ye start with no bonuses, they'll ramp up quickly during events!

Event adventures cost Event Tokens to start. Ye collect tokens just by killin' monsters in any campaign or adventure. The tokens for this event are called $token_plural, and ye've already got $token_count of them. If ye don't have enough to start an adventure now, don't fret. Just do a different adventure until ye've collected enough, then reset again.

Now that ye've recruited a new Champion, ye can gear them up by completing the variants or free play. The chests ye get from those adventures will award gear just for the new Champion! Ye can also buy more chests for them in the store while the event is runnin'.

Hey, before ye start a new adventure, there's an event active! Events are temporary campaigns that last for a limited time and provide great rewards, like brand new Champions. You're already on the event campaign map.

Now that ye've been on a few Adventures, your Champions are ready to expand their horizons a bit! Ye can now start adventurin' in the Tomb of Annihilation Campaign! This Campaign unlocks new Adventures in an all new map, with all new locations and a new formation!

It looks like ye've decided to visit a new Campaign! Yer party will be blessed by a different Deity in every Campaign, so you'll have to start earnin' Favor with them from scratch. Make sure you check what blessing this Deity provides to your party, so that ye can be sure you've set your Formation up to take advantage!
Familiars can now be summoned to help yer sore clickin' finger. Buy them here, then assign them to help ye click monsters, level up yer Champions, or trigger yer ultimate attacks.
Many familiars can be purchased fer gems, but a few will cost ye real money. They all do the same thin's, though.

news_defines.content: In Faerûn, the Running is a four day holiday during which most shops are closed and markets cancelled. Folks travel (as far as they can within those four days) to visit parents, kin, or friends for feasting, gossip, and making deals. For our intrepid band of heroes this is just enough time to take on a well-paying contract for a journey into the High Forest in search of a rare elven artifact. Complete the adventure to recruit Catti-Brie, a human fighter and our fourth Companion of the Hall! This event runs until Tuesday, May 15th, at noon PDT.
news_defines.title: New Event: The Running

news_defines.content: Today's update includes the largest number of new variants we've ever released at once! There are three new Grand Tour of the Sword Coast variants and two new Tomb of Annihilation variants, each more challenging and devious than the last. In addition, this update includes new upgrades for all Champions and more than half a dozen commonly requested quality of life fixes and features. Check out the change log for more details.
news_defines.title: New Variants and Features!

news_defines.content:
The start of spring is traditionally a day of peace and rejoicing marked by the display of flowers (even if they need to be grown in a hothouse during the winter months, or brought from southern climes) that are worn or given as sacrifices to the gods who have brought life back to the world. A group of Githyanki have other plans for the day, though.

Complete this adventure and recruit Nrakk, a Githzerai Monk. This event will run until Tuesday, April 24th at noon PDT. Good luck!
news_defines.title: New Event: Greengrass

news_defines.content:
Having survived a long, dark, cold winter, Festival of Fools participants don brightly colored and garishly patterned clothing and dance in the streets like court jesters, each competing with the others to see who can pull off the most foolish (yet generally harmless) prank(s). What could possibly go wrong with that?

This event unlocks Strix, the Trash Witch. She's a powerful caster swap for Jamilah, and should not be underestimated, regardless of her disheveled appearance. The event runs until Tuesday, April 10th at noon PDT. Good luck!
news_defines.title: New Event: Festival of Fools

news_defines.content:
Introducing Familiars! Familiars can be purchased for gems or real money and assigned to specific tasks, such as clicking enemies, leveling up champions, or using ultimates. There are six familiars available to purchase, three for gems and three via DLC. They all function the same, though. Check out the change log for more details.

Familiars unlock once you have reached area 66 in any campaign (for most existing players they will become available right away). The cheapest familiar costs 1,000 gems.
news_defines.title: New Feature: Familiars

changelog_defines.content:
Fixes:
- Fixed an issue where the familiar dialog would not stay up
- Fixed an issue where the DLC prices were not showing up on the familiar DLC dialogs
- Fixed an issue where the familiar button would not show up at all
- Fixed an issue where boss areas did not advance with 3 or 4 clicker familiars active
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #27.1

changelog_defines.content:
Fixes:
- Fixed an issue where the new familiar DLC was not awarding the correct number of potions (we have also re-credited all prior purchases so you now have the proper number of potions).
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #27.2

changelog_defines.content:
Features:
- Added the Festival of Fools event, our ninth limited-time campaign event! See the in-game FAQ for more information. The event will run until Tuesday, April 10th at noon PDT

Changes:
- Added weird apple-style rubber banding to the Champion bar for some reason
- Familiars will no longer cease buying upgrades when the specialization dialog is up
- Familiars will no longer click things that can't be damaged by clicking

Fixes:
- Fixed an issue with Familiars skipping upgrades in certain situations
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #28

changelog_defines.content:
Fixes:
- Fixed an issue where Strix would get stuck after transforming back from her Ultimate.
- Fixed an issue where monsters with segmented heath bars would cause progressive lag.
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #28.1

changelog_defines.content:
Fixes:
- Minor text fixes
- Ultimates that do a lot of hits (like Celeste's) should now do the correct number of hits to armor-based health monsters, like the Frost Giants
- Made several fixes to Strix's ultimate that should improve stability and remove some animation bugs
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #28.2

changelog_defines.content:
Features:
- Added a new weekend buff promotion

Fixes:
- Added several races to Jarlaxle's check for unique races (tortles, half-orcs, halflings, and gnomes)
-  Scrolling panels are less broken
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #28.3

changelog_defines.content:
Fixes:
- Armored hit-based enemies (like the Frost Giant) are no longer clicked by familiars
- Fixed some typos. Left in some others so reporters don't get complacent
- Fixed an issue where Strix's ultimate could sometimes cause Strix to stop attacking
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #28.4

changelog_defines.content:
Features:
- Added the Greengrass event, our tenth limited-time campaign event! See the in-game FAQ for more information. The event will run until Tuesday, April 24th at noon PDT

Changes:
- Many tweaks and optimizations related to builds for other platforms; please report anything odd that you see

Fixes:
- The Ability popup for Champions will now update changing properties (like Time Remaining) properly
- Fixed a bug where a hero with disabled Abilities (e.g. from a stun attack) would say it had disabled Damage instead
- Fixed a bug where the health bar for hits-based monsters might not update correctly when they received healing
- Fixed a bug where if you did multiple hits to a single monster in quick succession the damage popup could animate improperly
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #29

changelog_defines.content:
Features:
- Added Companion's Weekend promo

Fixes:
- Purchase buffs will no longer say that they expire when you reset your Adventure (since they don't)
- Fixed the Champion level up button not updating when you get enough gold to level them up (if you have UI Caching on)
- Fixed a tutorial issue when you get the Swapping tutorial and your available swap is off the Champion bar
- Fixed an issue with spacing in the name of the Silver Nrakk chest
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #29.1

changelog_defines.content:
Fixes:
- Weekend Promo buffs will no longer say they expire when you reset your Adventure
- Fixed some description errors on abilities that cause enemies to take extra damage (e.g. Ruby Weakness, Poor Hygiene)
- Fixed a bug where the Running of the Saurs area 50 boss spawning animation could prevent you from changing to different areas
- Fixed an issue where Familiar slots could get stuck after a reset
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #29.2

changelog_defines.content:
Features:
- Added five new variant adventures:
    - Escort to Waterdeep: Constant Banditry
    - Waterdeep Detours: Easily Distracted
    - Underdeep Cartography: Durable Deep
    - The Templar's Camp: Poor Guidance
- Rescue in the Jungle: Upholding the Law
- Added a panel to the reset screen that shows statistics about the completed adventure
- Monster types are now displayed when hovering over a monster, and hovering also brings their name and health bar to the front
- Added a new hotkey that toggles scientific notation (Y)
- Free Play adventures now show the original adventure name in the quest display
- Selected level-up multiplier is now remembered through reloads
- Autoprogress is now turned on by default when starting a new adventure
- Added a Community Champion achievement for players that "showcase outstanding community leadership" (Does not appear or count towards achievement total if not earned)
- If you get a golden item and already have a shiny item in that slot, you will now receive a bonus potion of polish which you can use to make a different item shiny
- Added a power-up bar that displays when bosses or monsters begin to power up

Clarification (no actual change):
- Barrowin's Blessed Hammer skill description changed to specify that it only buffs base attacks

Balance Changes:
- Added additional upgrades to all Champions, including a new "Bond" specialization choice for Asharra at level 350
- Zorbu's Favored Enemy upgrades now start with a 300% bonus damage instead of 100%

Changes:
- Hero boxes in the bottom bar have additional signifiers to show that they are in the formation
- Nrakk and Strix's ultimate attack tooltips/hovers will no longer show a damage value, as they don't do damage directly
- Updated the "Welcome Back" screen
- Upgrades that affect ultimate attacks now use the same icon as upgrades that unlock ultimate attacks 
- Spending divine favour warning changed to be more descriptive
- Adjusted the behavior of scroll panes

Fixes:
- Pressing 'Esc' while opening chests no longer closes the chest screen.
- Fixed several typos. You've almost found them all, but several more remain. Keep searching!
- Nrakk's ultimate description should now contain the correct buff amount based on all his ultimate bonuses (from gear, etc.)
- The description for Nrakk's Deft Strike should now show the proper buffed value
- Fixed a case where the shiny effect on cards in the Blacksmith Contract dialog could animate incorrectly

Coming Soon:
- Fixes for offline gold and party DPS calculations with certain Champions
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #30

changelog_defines.content:
Features:
- Added the Running event, our eleventh limited-time campaign event! See the in-game FAQ for more information. The event will run until Tuesday, May 15th at noon PDT

Balance Changes:
- Updated the ages of all the Companions of the Hall (Bruenor, Regis, and Drizzt)

Fixes:
- Fixed a bug where Champions could occasionally get revived from Strix with incorrect health
- Fixed a bug where formation saves could load unavailable Champions into the formation
- Fixed some more typos
changelog_defines.title: Early Access Update #31

$target's Attack now does $amount% AOE damage, every $every_num_attacks attacks
$target's Attack does $amount% more damage, every $every_num_attacks attacks
If $target's Attack stuns any enemies, decreases $target's cooldown by $cooldown seconds and increases the Damage by $amount% per enemy for the next attack (up to $limit% damage buff)
Reduces the cooldown on $target's next Base Attack by $(seconds_plural amount)
$target's Base Attack has a $amount% chance to stun hit enemies for $duration seconds
When $target's Base Attack hits a single enemy, they attack them again with $amount% more damage
Increases the radius of AOE effects on $target's Base Attack by $amount%
Increases the duration of Stun effects on $target's Base Attack by $amount%
$target's next Base Attack does $amount% bonus damage
$target takes $amount% of their Max Health in unavoidable Damage
Buffs Nrakk's Ultimate effect by $amount%
Starting from $start_percent% of the way from your formation, $target takes more damage the further they get from your formation, scaling up to $amount% more damage at $end_percent% distance

$source deals additional damage to enemies the farther they are from the formation: starting at 0% when they are $start_percent% from away from the formation, up to $amount% more damage when they are at $end_percent%
$source's attack has a $(buffed_crit_chance chance)% chance to crit for $amount% bonus damage
When $source hits an enemy, they take $amount% more damage from all Champions for $seconds seconds. During this time, if they get hit $hits times, they will be stunned for $stun_time seconds
Increases the chance for $(upgrade_name id) to crit by $amount%
$target does some effect on crit
Champions have a $chance% chance to do a critical hit for $amount% bonus damage when attacking $target
Copies attack_crit_chance effects to monsters as monster_crit_hit_chance
$(attack_names_and attack_ids) do double damage/hits
Sets the cooldown on $target's Ultimate Attack to $time seconds

loot_defines.name: Chipped Axe
loot_defines.description: It isn't much, but it'll get the job done.

loot_defines.name: Sharpened Axe
loot_defines.description: So sharp I can skin dinner with it.

loot_defines.name: Well Used Axe
loot_defines.description: I've lost count of the number of goblins slaughtered by its razor edge.

loot_defines.name: Many-notched Axe
loot_defines.description: This axe has seen a thousand battles, and been victorious in every one.

loot_defines.name: Iron Beard Clips
loot_defines.description: They're a bit heavy, but they keep my beard in check.

loot_defines.name: Steel Beard Clips
loot_defines.description: Lighter than your average clips, they let my beard swing furiously when I attack.

loot_defines.name: Dark Iron Beard Clips
loot_defines.description: Crafted from a meteorite that fell near Icewind Dale.

loot_defines.name: Gold Beard Clips of the Clan
loot_defines.description: Ancient family clips found in the depths of the Mithral Hall.

loot_defines.name: Frayed Belt
loot_defines.description: It'll hold up your pants, if you don't move around too quickly.

loot_defines.name: Faded Leather Belt
loot_defines.description: It's seen better days, but it still does the trick.

loot_defines.name: Thick Sturdy Belt
loot_defines.description: It's quite slimming!

loot_defines.name: Golden Hide Belt of the Ancestors
loot_defines.description: An ancient family belt recovered from a Battlehammer heirloom cache.

loot_defines.name: Plain Iron Ring
loot_defines.description: A simple ring with little magical power.

loot_defines.name: Shiny Steel Ring
loot_defines.description: A shiny ring that seems to radiate mild heat on its own.

loot_defines.name: Dark Iron Ring
loot_defines.description: A magical ring crafted from a fallen meteorite.

loot_defines.name: Golden Sigil Ring of Dwarves
loot_defines.description: Specially crafted by the craftsmen in Mirabar as a peace offering to Clan Battlehammer.

loot_defines.name: Dented Shield
loot_defines.description: Looks like someone took a warhammer to this.

loot_defines.name: Heavy Shield
loot_defines.description: If you can get it up in time, it'll do the job.

loot_defines.name: Strong Shield
loot_defines.description: It's strong enough to stop a blow from a raging giant.

loot_defines.name: Shield of Foaming Ale
loot_defines.description: A magical shield with secret and mysterious powers.

loot_defines.name: Broken Helm
loot_defines.description: To be fair, I think it's supposed to be broken.

loot_defines.name: Scuffed Helm
loot_defines.description: Someone needs to get some spit and polish on this thing.

loot_defines.name: Mithral Helm
loot_defines.description: Stronger than steel, and far lighter.

loot_defines.name: Gilded Helm of Clan Battlehammer
loot_defines.description: This helm has seen Bruenor through a hundred sticky situations.

loot_defines.name: Iron Headband
loot_defines.description: An understated headband with a small blue gem.

loot_defines.name: Silver Headband
loot_defines.description: A scuffed headband with brilliant potential.

loot_defines.name: Gold Headband
loot_defines.description: A complex headband composed of dozens of golden leaves.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Headband of Faith
loot_defines.description: A golden headband inlaid with a brilliant blue sapphire.

loot_defines.name: Cloth Gauntlets
loot_defines.description: They'll keep the dust off my hands, at least.

loot_defines.name: Leather Gauntlets
loot_defines.description: The inside is padded to protect against bumps and bruises.

loot_defines.name: Golden Gauntlets
loot_defines.description: Masterfully crafted to fit my hands precisely.

loot_defines.name: Scale Gauntlets of Selûne
loot_defines.description: The small inlaid sapphires - tears of Selûne herself - empower myself and my allies.

loot_defines.name: Cloth Belt
loot_defines.description: A basic belt from a simpler time in my life.

loot_defines.name: Soft Belt
loot_defines.description: Given to me by a sister cleric on my first day of worship at the temple.

loot_defines.name: Thick Scalemail Belt
loot_defines.description: This belt has saved my life in battle many times.

loot_defines.name: Obsidian Scale Belt of the Moon
loot_defines.description: The texture of this belt matches exactly the face of the goddess above.

loot_defines.name: Iron Amulet
loot_defines.description: Commonly carried by many of Selûne's acolytes.

loot_defines.name: Steel Amulet
loot_defines.description: A more durable form of a commonly carried amulet.

loot_defines.name: Copper Amulet
loot_defines.description: Often mistaken for gold, this amulet shines nearly as bright.

loot_defines.name: Golden Amulet of the Goddess
loot_defines.description: One of the few relics recovered from Shadowmantle's undead horde.

loot_defines.name: Cloth Boots
loot_defines.description: Comfortable, but not ideal for long journeys such as this one.

loot_defines.name: Smooth Leather Boots
loot_defines.description: Durable and soft, these boots can last a lifetime if properly cared for.

loot_defines.name: Chainmail Boots
loot_defines.description: Not the stealthiest boot, but then stealth was never my style.

loot_defines.name: Well Fitted Boots of Fellowship
loot_defines.description: One of Selûne's skilled followers crafted these for me after I saved them.

loot_defines.name: Faded Holy Symbol
loot_defines.description: Though old, this item still holds a dear place in my heart.

loot_defines.name: Understated Holy Symbol
loot_defines.description: Never underestimate the wrath of an angry goddess.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Holy Symbol
loot_defines.description: A fine tribute to the true goddess of the night sky.

loot_defines.name: Holy Symbol of Selûne's Grace
loot_defines.description: Bestowed upon me by the goddess herself in my greatest time of need.

loot_defines.name: Faded Figurine
loot_defines.description: A faded owl motif. Someday I'll tell you the story of it.

loot_defines.name: Hunting Figurine
loot_defines.description: A magical item used to hunt down those who have done wrong.

loot_defines.name: Detailed Owl Figurine
loot_defines.description: A brilliant serpentine owl figurine imbued with magical power.

loot_defines.name: Figurine Of Wondrous Power
loot_defines.description: A wondrous item that grants me the power to track down those I've sworn vengeance against.

loot_defines.name: Tarnished Breastplate
loot_defines.description: It's starting to rust, but it can still take a few good blows.

loot_defines.name: Iron Breastplate
loot_defines.description: A sturdy breastplate. Well enough to deliver evenhanded justice in, at least.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Breastplate
loot_defines.description: A fine breastplate, crafted using a special steel alloy known only to a few.

loot_defines.name: Breastplate of the Devoted Champion
loot_defines.description: It borders on gaudy, but you can't deny its raw power.

loot_defines.name: Heavy Chainmail Shirt
loot_defines.description: It restricts my movement, but not enough to hinder the Maimed God's justice.

loot_defines.name: Fine Chainmail Shirt
loot_defines.description: As fine a shirt as you could expect to find, from a common merchant.

loot_defines.name: Dwarven Mithral Shirt
loot_defines.description: Even dwarven folk can appreciate the need for Tyr's justice.

loot_defines.name: Finely Crafted Scalemail of Justice
loot_defines.description: Gifted to me by Lord Maldwyn, shortly before... I'd rather not talk about it.

loot_defines.name: Basic Gauntlets
loot_defines.description: Your run of the mill plate gauntlets.

loot_defines.name: Sturdy Gauntlets
loot_defines.description: They won't budge in battle, and with a sturdy wrist will deflect all but the strongest attack.

loot_defines.name: Paladin's Gauntlets
loot_defines.description: A finely crafted gauntlet worn by many Paladins throughout the land.

loot_defines.name: Gauntlets of Sworn Vengeance
loot_defines.description: Pristine scalemail gauntlets that give my blows a little extra oomph.

loot_defines.name: Simple Holy Symbol
loot_defines.description: The symbol of Tyr strikes fear into evil-doers everywhere.

loot_defines.name: Polished Holy Symbol
loot_defines.description: This symbol has been meticulously cared for over the years. A great sign of respect.

loot_defines.name: Devoted Holy Symbol
loot_defines.description: The Lord of Justice himself blessed this necklace.

loot_defines.name: Extravagant Symbol of Tyr
loot_defines.description: I've devoted my life to justice for all in Tyr's name.

loot_defines.name: Dull Iron Greatsword
loot_defines.description: A trainee's sword, but in the right hands, it can still do damage.

loot_defines.name: Sharp Steel Greatsword
loot_defines.description: Crafted by the finest smithy in Daggerford.

loot_defines.name: Strong Magical Greatsword
loot_defines.description: This sword vanquishes all foes, whether or not they come from this plane.

loot_defines.name: Blessed Sword of Tyr
loot_defines.description: The Lord of Justice blessed this sword and my mission on his behalf.

loot_defines.name: Common Rapier
loot_defines.description: Good enough for the common folk, but I'll soon be upgrading, I assure you.

loot_defines.name: Well Balanced Rapier
loot_defines.description: You can't be very effective with an unbalanced sword, you know!

loot_defines.name: Majestic Rapier
loot_defines.description: There's nothing quite so elegant or majestic as a finely crafted rapier.

loot_defines.name: Swashbuckling Rapier of Last Resort
loot_defines.description: When you need to put on a show, a rapier will often do the trick.

loot_defines.name: Effective Eye Patch
loot_defines.description: It does the job, but not much more.

loot_defines.name: Stylish Eye Patch
loot_defines.description: Now that's a swashbuckling look!

loot_defines.name: Enhanced Eye Patch
loot_defines.description: I've got a few more tricks up my sleeve. Or over my eye, rather.

loot_defines.name: Knave's Eye Patch
loot_defines.description: You can't hide from my magical eye... patch.

loot_defines.name: Faux Feathered Hat
loot_defines.description: It's not a real feather at all! Why would someone do this?

loot_defines.name: Gull Feathered Hat
loot_defines.description: A decent enough feather, I suppose. In a pinch.

loot_defines.name: Velvet Feathered Hat
loot_defines.description: It's a pleasure to wear, though not for my enemies.

loot_defines.name: Magical Diatryma Feathered Hat
loot_defines.description: You don't want to mess with this feather.

loot_defines.name: Faded Cloak
loot_defines.description: A quick dip in an enchanted underdark pool aught to brighten this right up.

loot_defines.name: Brightly Colored Cloak
loot_defines.description: A useful distraction if you want your foes to see your cloak and not yourself.

loot_defines.name: Lesser Piwafwi Cloak
loot_defines.description: It has some use, but it could be so much more.

loot_defines.name: Many-hued Piwafwi Cloak
loot_defines.description: With this cloak, I am all but invisible.

loot_defines.name: Dented Iron Ring
loot_defines.description: It once had magical powers, but now it's just an old piece of metal.

loot_defines.name: Scuffed Steel Ring
loot_defines.description: Rub it three times and a genie pops out. Aha! Gotcha! So gullible.

loot_defines.name: Ring of Power
loot_defines.description: But what power, you ask? I'll never tell.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Ring of Foresight
loot_defines.description: If I know where my enemies will be, they're that much easier to hit.

loot_defines.name: Simple Spurs
loot_defines.description: A simple accessory, but quite useful in the right situation.

loot_defines.name: Dull Steel Spurs
loot_defines.description: Remind me sometime to tell you the story of how I came into possession of these.

loot_defines.name: Shiny Mithral Spurs
loot_defines.description: Dirty dwarven metal, sure, but you can't deny the craftsmanship.

loot_defines.name: Masterful Golden Spurs
loot_defines.description: A stylish addition to any outfit!

loot_defines.name: Simple Crossbow Bolt
loot_defines.description: It doesn't have to be fancy, but it will be messy.

loot_defines.name: Sharpened Crossbow Bolt
loot_defines.description: You don't want to be on the receiving end of this.

loot_defines.name: Broadhead Crossbow Bolt
loot_defines.description: It nearly doesn't fit in my lute!

loot_defines.name: Expertly Fletched Crossbow Bolt
loot_defines.description: You really have to jam it in there, but it hurts when it comes out.

loot_defines.name: Untuned Lute
loot_defines.description: It sounds terrible, so what'll you give me to stop playing?

loot_defines.name: Partially Tuned Lute
loot_defines.description: I've heard better, but it's a good focus for my songs and spells.

loot_defines.name: Whitewood Lute
loot_defines.description: Sturdy instruments are key to constant paydays.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Lute of Ballads
loot_defines.description: Hey, are you even listening to me? Argh! That's it...!

loot_defines.name: Rough Cloak
loot_defines.description: It's a little scratchy, but it keeps me warm.

loot_defines.name: Bard's Cloak
loot_defines.description: Your average bard's cloak. Good for blending into crowds... of bards.

loot_defines.name: Triple-Clasped Cloak
loot_defines.description: The only way this thing comes flying off in combat is if I'm feeling especially fabulous.

loot_defines.name: Stealthy Performer's Cloak
loot_defines.description: You wouldn't think a bright red cloak could be stealthy, but here we are.

loot_defines.name: Soft Leather Bracers
loot_defines.description: Comfortable, but not much help in combat.

loot_defines.name: Stiff Hide Bracers
loot_defines.description: You could deflect a dull sword with these, if you're quick enough, which I am.

loot_defines.name: Studded Leather Bracers
loot_defines.description: Some of the best wrist-based protection a girl can ask for.

loot_defines.name: Fingerless Bracers of the Foul Mouth
loot_defines.description: I know what you're thinking: aren't all bracers fingerless? Yeah, well... Shut up.

loot_defines.name: Patched Bag
loot_defines.description: You can't see it, but this thing is barely holding together.

loot_defines.name: Sturdy Leather Bag
loot_defines.description: It's holding knick-knacks from dozens of passed out pirates. They won't miss 'em.

loot_defines.name: Magically Enhanced Satchel
loot_defines.description: Touch the gem in the wrong way and boom! Hope you weren't too attached to that hand.

loot_defines.name: Leather Satchel of the Wanderer
loot_defines.description: I've seen plenty of the world, but I'm more than happy to see more of it.

loot_defines.name: Dusty Eyepatch
loot_defines.description: It's a little irritating, but it's stylish.

loot_defines.name: Soft Cloth Eyepatch
loot_defines.description: A pleasure to wear - it's like a blanket for my eye!

loot_defines.name: Sturdy Leather Eyepatch
loot_defines.description: A sturdy accessory that aids in my night time adventures.

loot_defines.name: Magical Eyepatch of the Bard
loot_defines.description: Oh, you want to know what my magical eyepatch does? Get in line, sailor.

loot_defines.name: Simple Jade Spear
loot_defines.description: The tip isn't as fragile as it looks.

loot_defines.name: Sharp Jade Spear
loot_defines.description: Crafted by the finest Aarakocra smiths in Kir Sabal.

loot_defines.name: Magical Jade Spear
loot_defines.description: Imbued with magical power by the wizards of Kir Sabal.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Jade Spear of the Mind
loot_defines.description: The finest spear I've seen in all my years protecting the skies of Chult.

loot_defines.name: Orb of Breezes
loot_defines.description: This orb causes the air around you to shift and swirl.

loot_defines.name: Orb of Gusts
loot_defines.description: This orb causes the air around you to gust and blow your robes.

loot_defines.name: Orb of Squalls
loot_defines.description: This orb causes a strong wind to swirl past you, making footing difficult.

loot_defines.name: Hurricane Orb of Storms
loot_defines.description: Without proper discipline, this orb could cause you to be swept off your feet.

loot_defines.name: Pilling Robe
loot_defines.description: This robe has clearly seen better days.

loot_defines.name: Long Robe
loot_defines.description: This robe fits perfectly, and flutters about pleasingly as you fly.

loot_defines.name: Golden Robe
loot_defines.description: A golden robe with light colors and brilliant golden cloud motifs.

loot_defines.name: Swirling Robe of Gusting Wind
loot_defines.description: This robe seems to have a mind of its own, swirling about you even when the wind is calm.

loot_defines.name: Simple Pouch
loot_defines.description: A simple pouch for storing spell components and trinkets.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Asharra's Bond abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Dual Cloth Pouches
loot_defines.description: Twice the storage potential compared to single pouches!

effects.description: Increases the effect of Asharra's Bond abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Hardened Leather Pouch
loot_defines.description: A well loved pouch that I'd guess belonged to a lesser Aarakocra priest or cleric.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Asharra's Bond abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Bottomless Pouch of Components
loot_defines.description: The components for nearly any spell you could imagine can be found in these pouches.

loot_defines.name: Common Aarakocra Necklace
loot_defines.description: A common necklace worn by the Aarakocra residents of Kir Sabal.

loot_defines.name: Scuffed Aarakocra Necklace
loot_defines.description: This necklace has seen combat, but is still holding together well. It must be lucky!

loot_defines.name: Jeweled Aarakocra Necklace
loot_defines.description: This fine necklace obviously belonged to a powerful Aarakocra at some point in the past.

loot_defines.name: Masterfully Crafted Aarakocra Necklace
loot_defines.description: The craftsmanship on this necklace puts all others to shame.

loot_defines.name: Brass Armlet
loot_defines.description: A simple armlet, but good enough for the time being.

loot_defines.name: Polished Armlet
loot_defines.description: A well loved armlet that its previous owner obviously adored.

loot_defines.name: Jeweled Copper Armlet
loot_defines.description: A shiny armlet with what looks like a small citrine or amber set in it.

loot_defines.name: Magnificent Golden Armlet of Focus
loot_defines.description: A beautiful golden armlet set with a shining fire opal.

loot_defines.name: Chipped Greatsword
loot_defines.description: Here's a tip for any adventurer: swords don't do so well against enemies made entirely of diamond.

loot_defines.name: Well Used Greatsword
loot_defines.description: Minsc has had this old blade nearly as long as he's been adventuring with Boo.

loot_defines.name: Sharp Greatsword
loot_defines.description: Minsc just got this sharpened by a smithy in Baldur's Gate. Good fellow. Cheap.

loot_defines.name: Grand Greatsword of Furious Blows
loot_defines.description: Evil, meet my sword! Sword, meet evil!

loot_defines.name: Basic Leather Vest
loot_defines.description: Less vest, more buttkicking!

loot_defines.name: Smooth Leather Vest
loot_defines.description: Smooth like a miniature giant space hamster's bottom! Smells like one, too!

loot_defines.name: Reinforced Leather Vest
loot_defines.description: It's got holes for Minsc's extremely large biceps, so Minsc is a fan!

loot_defines.name: Padded Leather Vest of Hamster Perches
loot_defines.description: Boo! Are you comfortable up there?

loot_defines.name: Cheap Iron Bracers
loot_defines.description: They may be cheap, but they do keep Minsc from lopping his own hands off.

loot_defines.name: Dull Iron Bracers
loot_defines.description: Hey, who are you calling dull?! Oh, the bracers. Yeah, they're pretty dull.

loot_defines.name: Full Iron Bracers
loot_defines.description: This reminds Minsc of a time... never mind.

loot_defines.name: Padded Iron Bracers of Comfort
loot_defines.description: Adventuring is quite exciting - at least until it's not. Then you need to be comfortable.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Minsc's Favored Enemy abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Faded Purple Cloak
loot_defines.description: It could use a little more color. Minsc knows a fellow in Waterdeep...

effects.description: Increases the effect of Minsc's Favored Enemy abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Smooth Purple Cloak
loot_defines.description: A decent enough cloak. If you're into normal things like that.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Minsc's Favored Enemy abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Purple Velvet Cloak
loot_defines.description: Oh! It's so soft! Don't even think about stealing it to nest in, Boo!

effects.description: Increases the effect of Minsc's Favored Enemy abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Silken Cloak of the Beloved Ranger
loot_defines.description: Minsc saves some king's daughter, and this is all he gets? Barely worth it!

loot_defines.name: Fraying Belt
loot_defines.description: Perhaps you will upgrade this belt the next time you are in town, yes?

loot_defines.name: Loose Belt
loot_defines.description: A good belt for long nights at the all-you-can-eat tavern!

loot_defines.name: Tight Leather Belt
loot_defines.description: It's important to keep your pants up, lest boo bite you in hard to reach places.

loot_defines.name: Comfortable Belt of Destruction
loot_defines.description: Go for the belt, Boo! Go for the belt!

loot_defines.name: Simple Ranger Boots
loot_defines.description: You don't need fancy boots to kick some bad guy butt!

loot_defines.name: Smooth Studded Boots
loot_defines.description: They've got good traction if we ever head up north to Icewind Dale.

loot_defines.name: Solid Plate Boots
loot_defines.description: Solid buttkicking soles! Good find, Boo!

loot_defines.name: Buttkicking Boots of Wrath
loot_defines.description: Some of these enemies need a swift kick in the morals!

loot_defines.name: Dull Iron Dagger
loot_defines.description: I prefer to stick to my magic, but in a pinch, I can use this.

loot_defines.name: Cutpurse's Dagger
loot_defines.description: I borrowed this from a cutpurse in Baldur's Gate who thought he could steal from me.

loot_defines.name: Sharp Steel Dagger
loot_defines.description: I don't like to resort to violence, but if I have to, this'll do.

loot_defines.name: Ruby Focused Dagger of Danger
loot_defines.description: In a pinch, I can channel my spells through the ruby on this dagger.

loot_defines.name: Pilfered Memento
loot_defines.description: Some trinket? It doesn't interest me, but it has some power within.

loot_defines.name: Follower's Necklace
loot_defines.description: This belonged to an acolyte of the Cult of the Dragon.

loot_defines.name: Master's Necklace
loot_defines.description: Someone of great power wore this necklace. But they're gone, and I'm still here.

loot_defines.name: Dragon Cult Leader's Necklace
loot_defines.description: My twin brother's necklace. It's a long story, and I'd rather not get into it.

loot_defines.name: Basic Orb
loot_defines.description: Very similar to the first focus given to me by my teacher.

loot_defines.name: Hovering Orb
loot_defines.description: Getting your focus to hover in your hand is the first task assigned to novice sorcerers.

loot_defines.name: Charged Orb
loot_defines.description: Channeling the Weave into your focus allows you to charge your spells.

loot_defines.name: Magical Orb of Elvenkind
loot_defines.description: This magical artifact has been passed down through generations of elves.

loot_defines.name: Loose Belt
loot_defines.description: More of a style piece than actually functional.

loot_defines.name: Simple Leather Belt
loot_defines.description: A simple enough belt. The sheath has a few holes in it.

loot_defines.name: Fine Belt and Sheath
loot_defines.description: A fine gift from a young human who once fancied me.

loot_defines.name: Golden Wayfarer's Belt of Adventure
loot_defines.description: I'm always up for an adventure! The more dangerous the better!

loot_defines.name: Ratty Cape
loot_defines.description: A simple sorcerer's cape with more than a few holes.

loot_defines.name: Smooth Cape
loot_defines.description: Someone has recently cleaned the cape. It wasn't me!

loot_defines.name: High Collared Cape
loot_defines.description: I look like quite the mature and knowledgeable elf wearing this. Little do they know.

loot_defines.name: Empowered Cape of Protection
loot_defines.description: It may look flimsy, but I can shrug off most attacks wearing this.

loot_defines.name: Scratchy Robes
loot_defines.description: I can't believe anyone would wear these! Better than nothing, I guess.

loot_defines.name: Comfortable Robes
loot_defines.description: Hey, these are actually pretty comfy! Good find!

loot_defines.name: Masterful Silken Robe
loot_defines.description: I've been searching for the master who crafted this for years. It's wondrous!

loot_defines.name: Swirling Patterned Robe of Sorcery
loot_defines.description: My spells are empowered when I wear this cape. Not that they need to be.

loot_defines.name: Necklace of Sparks
loot_defines.description: A few sparks are a beginning, but they're certainly not an end.

loot_defines.name: Necklace of Flickers
loot_defines.description: We're going to need to do better than this.

loot_defines.name: Necklace of Flame
loot_defines.description: Where there's smoke...

loot_defines.name: Golden Necklace of Fireballs
loot_defines.description: This ought to draw their attention.

loot_defines.name: Suspicious Dagger
loot_defines.description: There's something a little off about this dagger.

loot_defines.name: Evil Dagger
loot_defines.description: Yeah, this dagger is clearly evil. But it does my bidding, so it's not all bad.

loot_defines.name: Twisted Dagger Focus
loot_defines.description: Allows me to focus my fiendish magic.

loot_defines.name: Demonic Focus of Infernal Power
loot_defines.description: I'll do whatever it takes to achieve my goals.

loot_defines.name: Small Cloth Pouch
loot_defines.description: Holds enough components for a few hours of intense spellcasting.

loot_defines.name: Stitched Leather Pouch
loot_defines.description: There's a hidden compartment in the back for even more components.

loot_defines.name: Dyed Leather Pouch
loot_defines.description: Finding black leather dye is extremely difficult. Luckily, I know a Fiend or two.

loot_defines.name: Gilded Demon Hide Pouch
loot_defines.description: Demon hide is especially rare. They generally don't like to give it up.

loot_defines.name: Torn Cape
loot_defines.description: They... they tore my cape! The nerve!

loot_defines.name: Dark Cape
loot_defines.description: I'm really still quite evil, once you get to know me.

loot_defines.name: Magnificent Cape
loot_defines.description: Magnificent, much like myself!

loot_defines.name: Exquisite Cape of Souls
loot_defines.description: Don't worry, they weren't very nice souls to begin with.

loot_defines.name: Basic Warlock's Robe
loot_defines.description: This has no real value to me. I've grown so far beyond its meager power.

loot_defines.name: Apprentice's Robe
loot_defines.description: A simple robe for a simple warlock. I've already outgrown it.

loot_defines.name: Gold Stitched Robe
loot_defines.description: Finally, a robe worthy of my great power.

loot_defines.name: Tasselled Robes of Justification
loot_defines.description: The ends justify the means. I'll do whatever it takes.

loot_defines.name: Charred Belt
loot_defines.description: You can't make an omelette without burning a few belts.

loot_defines.name: Blackened Belt
loot_defines.description: For some reason, my patron seems to like it when I wear black.

loot_defines.name: Fine Acolyte's Belt
loot_defines.description: A rare gift from my patron, Arikas. It serves me well.

loot_defines.name: Skirted Belt of Demons
loot_defines.description: An exquisite belt for those of us with fiendish tastes.

loot_defines.name: Splintered Branch
loot_defines.description: Even a splintered branch can do damage in the right hands.

loot_defines.name: Patched Tree Branch
loot_defines.description: It's a splinted splintered branch. Get it? Aww, you're no fun.

loot_defines.name: Twisted Wooden Staff
loot_defines.description: The twisting only serves to make it stronger.

loot_defines.name: Gnarled Staff of the Warden
loot_defines.description: The tree this staff came from is older than time itself.

loot_defines.name: Dull Jade Necklace
loot_defines.description: A simple necklace for simple adventurers.

loot_defines.name: Shiny Jade Necklace
loot_defines.description: There's something about jade that always tickles my fancy.

loot_defines.name: Fine Jade Necklace
loot_defines.description: A fine necklace purchased from a merchant in Triboar.

loot_defines.name: Woven Jade Necklace of the Forest
loot_defines.description: An ancient necklace found deep in the Neverwinter wood.

loot_defines.name: Plain Rope
loot_defines.description: Fifty feet of strong hempen rope. Durable and versatile.

loot_defines.name: Twitching Rope
loot_defines.description: It seems to want something... What do you want, little rope?

loot_defines.name: Magical Rope
loot_defines.description: Good for getting to high places when there's nothing to tie rope to.

loot_defines.name: Empowered Rope of Entanglement
loot_defines.description: It's easier for you if you don't fight it. It feeds on your struggles.

loot_defines.name: Ripped Cloth Vest
loot_defines.description: It's taken a few too many trips through the brambles, if you know what I mean.

loot_defines.name: Plain Cloth Vest
loot_defines.description: A workable vest. Relatively new and uninitiated to nature.

loot_defines.name: Fine Cloth Shirt
loot_defines.description: A fine shirt. I almost feel bad taking it out into the wild. Almost.

loot_defines.name: Earthwarden's Shirt of Nature
loot_defines.description: One of the few items I kept from my home village after... Nevermind.

loot_defines.name: Empty Bag of Tricks
loot_defines.description: It's may be out of tricks, but I've still got some up my sleeve.

loot_defines.name: Basic Bag of Tricks
loot_defines.description: Filled with powders to distract, to itch, to blind.

loot_defines.name: Hefty Bag of Tricks
loot_defines.description: It's almost too heavy to carry. Perhaps that's a trick for its owner.

loot_defines.name: Mystical Tan Bag of Tricks
loot_defines.description: There's a hint of magic in all of these tricks.

loot_defines.name: Wooden Ring
loot_defines.description: Crafted from a fallen branch donated by a very old and wise tree.

loot_defines.name: Basic Ring of the Mole
loot_defines.description: Moles have one of the keenest noses in the world, you know.

loot_defines.name: Fine Ring of the Frog
loot_defines.description: Frogs have many fine attributes that are quite useful when adventuring.

loot_defines.name: Exquisite Ring of the Porcupine
loot_defines.description: Much like the Porcupine, if you poke me, you'll regret it.

loot_defines.name: Primitive Bangles
loot_defines.description: A bangle or two from my days as a youth.

loot_defines.name: Wooden Bangles
loot_defines.description: Carved from the most wondrous trees that grow only in Chult.

loot_defines.name: Metal Bangles
loot_defines.description: More elegant arm wear for a more successful adventurer.

loot_defines.name: Precious Inscribed Bangles of Chult
loot_defines.description: Beautiful bangles bought from an adventurous merchant.

loot_defines.name: Scuffed Boots
loot_defines.description: Someone hasn't been taking good care of their boots.

loot_defines.name: Soft Boots
loot_defines.description: Uncommonly soft and comfortable, they allow me to be light on my feet.

loot_defines.name: Stealthy Boots
loot_defines.description: A fine pair of boots with a padded sole.

loot_defines.name: Masterful Boots of Elvenkind
loot_defines.description: They'll never hear me coming.

loot_defines.name: Trainee's Greatsword
loot_defines.description: I had a similar sword in my youth. I outgrew it quickly.

loot_defines.name: Apprentice's Greatsword
loot_defines.description: A sharp blade, but not too sharp that you'll slip up and grievously injure yourself.

loot_defines.name: Master's Greatsword
loot_defines.description: A fine sword fit for a Chultan sword master.

loot_defines.name: Deathbringer Greatsword
loot_defines.description: They'll never see me coming.

loot_defines.name: Simple Periapt
loot_defines.description: A simple periapt that grants some small magic.

loot_defines.name: Fine Periapt
loot_defines.description: A fine trinket passed down for generations.

loot_defines.name: Heroic Periapt
loot_defines.description: A heroic amulet granted to me by a village leader after I saved some villagers.

loot_defines.name: Periapt of Wound Closure
loot_defines.description: I pray that death will never find me, but if it does I'll be ready.

loot_defines.name: Cold Ring
loot_defines.description: There's not much power left in this ring.

loot_defines.name: Warm Ring
loot_defines.description: Something lurks within. This ring holds a small amount of power.

loot_defines.name: Emerald Ring
loot_defines.description: The beauty of this ring is eclipsed only by its power.

loot_defines.name: Ring of Protection
loot_defines.description: The power of this ring allows me to charge into battle carefree.

loot_defines.name: Torn Scarf
loot_defines.description: Nothing's worse than a cold neck. Not even this scarf.

loot_defines.name: Plain Scarf
loot_defines.description: A simple scarf to ward off the bitter wind.

loot_defines.name: Patterned Scarf
loot_defines.description: A fine scarf purchased from a merchant in Port Nyanzaru.

loot_defines.name: Tasselled Scarf of the Island
loot_defines.description: A masterfully crafted scarf found in the wreckage of the boat that brought me to Chult.

loot_defines.name: Dull Battle Axe
loot_defines.description: Even a blunt blade can bash in a skull.

loot_defines.name: Sharp Battle Axe
loot_defines.description: Ah, a freshly sharpened axe. What more does a guy need?

loot_defines.name: Cruel Battle Axe
loot_defines.description: The craftsmanship is exquisite.

loot_defines.name: Bonecleaver
loot_defines.description: A magical axe of extreme power. My enemies flee in fear when they see it.

loot_defines.name: Crude Symbol
loot_defines.description: A crude symbol, but any reverence to Tiamat is a good thing.

loot_defines.name: Steel Symbol
loot_defines.description: A well crafted symbol, though it lacks a certain finesse.

loot_defines.name: Flame Forged Symbol
loot_defines.description: Forged in the dragonflame for only the most devout followers.

loot_defines.name: Holy Symbol of Tiamat
loot_defines.description: I've foresworn my paladin oaths and dedicated my life to serving Tiamat.

loot_defines.name: Clanking Pauldron
loot_defines.description: Should probably get this tightened up. The noise is very distracting.

loot_defines.name: Solid Pauldron
loot_defines.description: Good for bashing down doors and breaking through walls.

loot_defines.name: Spiked Pauldron
loot_defines.description: I'll impale the heads of my enemies on these spikes! Hah hah hah!

loot_defines.name: Pauldron of the Dragonmother
loot_defines.description: Forged from obsidian and granted to me by the Dragon Queen herself.

loot_defines.name: Flimsy Shield
loot_defines.description: It may be flimsy, but you still wouldn't want to get bashed by it.

loot_defines.name: Strong Shield
loot_defines.description: Don't let appearances deceive you. This is a sturdy, well-crafted shield.

loot_defines.name: Dragon-Blessed Shield
loot_defines.description: Blessed by the Cult of the Dragon and carried into battle against their enemies.

loot_defines.name: Dragonscale Shield of the Unholy
loot_defines.description: Crafted from the scales of Tiamat's enemies and worn by her unholy Paladin followers.

loot_defines.name: Cracked Vial
loot_defines.description: Whatever is in it won't be in it for long!

loot_defines.name: Sturdy Vial
loot_defines.description: A sturdy vial containing a murky, greyish liquid.

loot_defines.name: Crystal Vial
loot_defines.description: A crystal vial with a finely crafted silver stopper.

loot_defines.name: Vial of Unholy Water
loot_defines.description: Filled to the brim with unholy power.

loot_defines.name: Rusty Choker
loot_defines.description: Reserved for only the most bad-ass warriors.

loot_defines.name: Spiked Choker
loot_defines.description: Mere child's play. Bring me a real choker.

loot_defines.name: Golden Wreath
loot_defines.description: A golden wreath of thorns worn about ones neck.

loot_defines.name: Wreath of the Prism
loot_defines.description: Grants me control over a beast of my choosing. I chose Chango.

loot_defines.name: Basic Pouch
loot_defines.description: Fits a moderate amount of gold pieces.

loot_defines.name: Deep Pouch
loot_defines.description: It doesn't look like much, but it can store quite a bit of loot.

loot_defines.name: Multi-Pouch
loot_defines.description: Why have one pouch when you could have five?

loot_defines.name: Burglar's Pack of the Sneaky Thief
loot_defines.description: It's got everything you need to pillage and pilfer.

loot_defines.name: Ugly Slippers
loot_defines.description: Hey! My mother knit these for me.

loot_defines.name: Sticky Slippers
loot_defines.description: I think a spider crawled inside these and webbed them up.

loot_defines.name: Sticky Boots
loot_defines.description: I can scale all but the slipperiest surfaces.

loot_defines.name: Boots of Spider Climbing
loot_defines.description: Useful for climbing giants and other extra tall creatures.

loot_defines.name: Pilfered Cape
loot_defines.description: It was just hanging in the cloakroom of this Inn...

loot_defines.name: Borrowed Cape
loot_defines.description: I'll give it back when I'm done with it, I swear.

loot_defines.name: Impressive Cape
loot_defines.description: It's impressive, much like myself!

loot_defines.name: Magnificent Cape of Free Flowing
loot_defines.description: It never gets tangled in my legs.

loot_defines.name: Dull Dagger
loot_defines.description: I really ought to sharpen this one.

loot_defines.name: Bloody Dagger
loot_defines.description: I really ought to clean this one.

loot_defines.name: Golden Dagger
loot_defines.description: Everything's better with a little gold added in.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Dagger of Princes
loot_defines.description: Stolen from a foolish Prince from the east.

loot_defines.name: Fake Ring
loot_defines.description: The peddler swore it was real!

loot_defines.name: Pearl Ring
loot_defines.description: There's a story behind this ring that I'll tell you some time.

loot_defines.name: Crystal Ring
loot_defines.description: That's 100% legitimate Icewind Crystal.

loot_defines.name: Zhentarim Ring of True Sight
loot_defines.description: You can't hide your true form from me.

loot_defines.name: Copper Rod
loot_defines.description: A simple rod of copper. Useful for jimmying doors and windows.

loot_defines.name: Fancy Rod
loot_defines.description: It's the fanciest thing I've ever jimmied a window with.

loot_defines.name: Static Rod
loot_defines.description: It has some small magical properties that makes it quite useful.

loot_defines.name: Ancient Immovable Rod
loot_defines.description: Magically enhanced to ignore the laws of physics.

loot_defines.name: Tight Belt
loot_defines.description: I like cake too much to really be comfortable in this belt.

loot_defines.name: Solemn Belt
loot_defines.description: The monks didn't let me bring much with me, except this.

loot_defines.name: Tinkerer's Belt
loot_defines.description: There's more to this belt than meets the eye.

loot_defines.name: Gnomish Belt of Solemn Secrets
loot_defines.description: I'll never talk about the day I got this belt.

loot_defines.name: See-Through Blindfold
loot_defines.description: Kind of defeats the purpose, don't it?

loot_defines.name: Blinding Blindfold
loot_defines.description: I can't see! Wait, no, that's the point.

loot_defines.name: Supremely Effective Blindfold
loot_defines.description: The monks made me wear this during my training.

loot_defines.name: Pure Blindfold of the Even Hand
loot_defines.description: A trophy from my time at the monastary.

loot_defines.name: Plain Ring
loot_defines.description: I'd rather not stand out, to be honest.

loot_defines.name: Scuffed Steel Ring
loot_defines.description: A little worse for wear from years of unarmed combat.

loot_defines.name: Obsidian Ring
loot_defines.description: Forged near a Chultan volcano.

loot_defines.name: Innoculous Ring of Time Slowing
loot_defines.description: I can really take my time to think things over.

loot_defines.name: Patched Robe
loot_defines.description: A hand-sown hand-me-down.

loot_defines.name: Initiate's Robe
loot_defines.description: Granted to all new diciples of the Even Hand.

loot_defines.name: Even Hand Robes
loot_defines.description: Robes bearing the colors of the Order of the Even Hand.

loot_defines.name: Monastic Robe of the Even Hand
loot_defines.description: I remember the day I earned the right to wear these robes...

loot_defines.name: Plain Sandals
loot_defines.description: The soles are a bit tough, but otherwise they're functional.

loot_defines.name: Comfortable Sandals
loot_defines.description: As comfortable for walking as they are for standing or sitting.

loot_defines.name: Intricate Sandals
loot_defines.description: Flashy, for a monk, but I'm still a gnome, you know.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Sandals of the Silent Foot
loot_defines.description: All but my most perceptive foes are ignorant to my approach.

loot_defines.name: Snapped Staff
loot_defines.description: I've tried binding it back together, but it's not very sturdy.

loot_defines.name: Sturdy Staff
loot_defines.description: I've walked a long way with this staff.

loot_defines.name: Wanderer's Staff
loot_defines.description: No matter how far you walk, you'll always end up back where you started.

loot_defines.name: Ki Staff of Long Walks
loot_defines.description: It is much easier to focus on ki with this ancient staff.

loot_defines.name: Stone Amulet
loot_defines.description: A basic amulet given to all orc children.

loot_defines.name: Warm Amulet
loot_defines.description: Obviously magical - it radiates heat.

loot_defines.name: Tribal Amulet
loot_defines.description: An amulet of warding constructed by our tribal sage; doesn't really do anything.

loot_defines.name: Bone Breaker Amulet of the Tribe
loot_defines.description: My father's amulet; worn in battle dozens, perhaps hundreds of time.

loot_defines.name: Cloth Belt
loot_defines.description: A simple belt; better to wear this than to have your pants fall down.

loot_defines.name: Soft Belt
loot_defines.description: Softness isn't often a quality I admire, but I make an exception for this belt.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Belt
loot_defines.description: A wizard's belt, but still useful to a warrior such as myself.

loot_defines.name: Artisan Belt of the Way Finder
loot_defines.description: This belt belonged to my mother; it saw her safely through countless dangers.

loot_defines.name: Torn History Book
loot_defines.description: So much is missing; someone who learns history from this book is bound to repeat it.

loot_defines.name: Faded History Book
loot_defines.description: There are important lessons in all of our pasts.

loot_defines.name: Detailed History Book
loot_defines.description: A detailed history of half-orc culture, written by myself.

loot_defines.name: Archaeologist's Book of Tribal History
loot_defines.description: A detailed encyclopedia of orc tribes and customs - my mother's life work.

loot_defines.name: Cracked Warhammer
loot_defines.description: It cracked when I hit a Stone Golem so hard that it shattered.

loot_defines.name: Solid Warhammer
loot_defines.description: Heavy to carry around, but worth it in battle.

loot_defines.name: Spiked Warhammer
loot_defines.description: A warrior needs every advantage to catch his enemy off guard.

loot_defines.name: Vicious Warhammer of Orcish Bloodlust
loot_defines.description: My bonded warhammer has served me well throughout the years.

loot_defines.name: Pilling Scarf
loot_defines.description: I should probably get this replaced.

loot_defines.name: Hand-knit Scarf
loot_defines.description: Yes, I knit. What's your problem with that?

loot_defines.name: Wizard's Scarf
loot_defines.description: A fine scarf, though not very warrior-ly.

loot_defines.name: Flowing Scarf of the Eldritch Knight
loot_defines.description: A momento from my time training as an Eldritch Knight.

loot_defines.name: Weak Pauldron
loot_defines.description: Adaquete for a child perhaps, but I hope to find a new pair soon enough.

loot_defines.name: Tough Pauldron
loot_defines.description: Hardened leather can surprisingly deflect even strong and sharp attacks.

loot_defines.name: Spiked Pauldron
loot_defines.description: A good shoulder charge never hurt anyone; perhaps just my enemies.

loot_defines.name: Strong Iron Pauldron of the Charging Orc
loot_defines.description: If magic fails me, these pauldrons will see me through.

loot_defines.name: Random Pebbles
loot_defines.description: An assortment of random pebbles from my journies.

loot_defines.name: Polished Pebbles
loot_defines.description: Some polished stones that caught my eye.

loot_defines.name: Colorful Stones
loot_defines.description: A considerable collection of colorful calcite.

loot_defines.name: Carefully Collected Pristine Pebbles
loot_defines.description: I've collected a single pebble from each beach I've visited in my travels.

loot_defines.name: Dull Spear
loot_defines.description: It's more for show. These old bones don't fight as well as they used to.

loot_defines.name: Damaged Spear
loot_defines.description: Held together with wax and sap and a short length of leather.

loot_defines.name: Sharpened Spear
loot_defines.description: Danger lies around every corner these days.

loot_defines.name: Masterful Spear of Long Journies
loot_defines.description: It doubles as a walking staff when the danger is past.

loot_defines.name: Old Pouch
loot_defines.description: Full of knick-knacks from another time.

loot_defines.name: Soft Leather Pouch
loot_defines.description: The leather has been softened by years of use.

loot_defines.name: Well Traveled Leather Pouch
loot_defines.description: This pouch has seen me through countless adventures.

loot_defines.name: Sacred Pouch of the Wayfinder
loot_defines.description: There always seems to be something in this pouch to point me in the right direction.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Gromma's Spiked Shell, Freezing Breeze and Acid Splash abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Delicate Headdress
loot_defines.description: If I move too quickly, it could shatter. I'd better more slowly, then.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Gromma's Spiked Shell, Freezing Breeze and Acid Splash abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Coral Headdress
loot_defines.description: The warm waters off the coast of Ahoyhoy are perfect for collecting discarded coral.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Gromma's Spiked Shell, Freezing Breeze and Acid Splash abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Braided Headdress
loot_defines.description: A special headdress crafted by one of my many offspring.

effects.description: Increases the effect of Gromma's Spiked Shell, Freezing Breeze and Acid Splash abilities by $(amount)%.

loot_defines.name: Intricate Headdress of the Grandmother
loot_defines.description: A gift from the first of my grandchildren to leave the compound and explore the lands.

loot_defines.name: Fragile Conch
loot_defines.description: Its days are numbered.

loot_defines.name: Hearty Conch
loot_defines.description: You can hear the ocean if you put it up to your ear.

loot_defines.name: Ancient Conch
loot_defines.description: This large conch is older than I am, and I'm practically ancient.

loot_defines.name: Spiked Conch of the Deep Ocean
loot_defines.description: Recovered from the slimy tentacles of a slain Marine Decapus.

loot_defines.name: Sandy Bracelet
loot_defines.description: Covered in itchy, scratching sand.

loot_defines.name: Single Pearl Bracelet
loot_defines.description: A single, brilliant pearl makes this bracelet worth wearing.

loot_defines.name: Dual-Banded Bracelet
loot_defines.description: Crafted for me by a young human during a recent visit to Port Nyanzaru.

loot_defines.name: Solemn Bone Bracelet of the Wind
loot_defines.description: If you put your ear up to the pearl, you can hear the approach of strong storms.

loot_defines.name: Tattered Belt
loot_defines.description: An embaressment to belts everywhere.

loot_defines.name: Scholar's Belt
loot_defines.description: A belt for someone who spends too much time reading and not enough time being amazing.

loot_defines.name: Wizard's Belt
loot_defines.description: Adaquete for a wizard from the coast, perhaps, but someone as great as Dhadius!

loot_defines.name: Glorious Belt of the Impressive Wizard
loot_defines.description: I certainly am that.

loot_defines.name: Clumsy Bracer
loot_defines.description: A bracer for a lesser mage. I object to wearing it, honestly.

loot_defines.name: Leather Bracer
loot_defines.description: Provides some deflection, I suppose. Not that I need it.

loot_defines.name: Arcane Bracer
loot_defines.description: Empowers my already formidable magical abilities.

loot_defines.name: Wonderous Bracer of the Greatest Wizard
loot_defines.description: Well, if you say so.

loot_defines.name: Ratty Cloak
loot_defines.description: It'll do until I can get back into my usual wardrobe.

loot_defines.name: Apprentice's Cloak
loot_defines.description: It's not mine, I'm just borrowing it.

loot_defines.name: Velvet Cloak
loot_defines.description: Velvet is the hallmark of impressive wizards, you know.

loot_defines.name: Flowing Cloak of the Respected Wizard
loot_defines.description: I am respected, aren't I?

loot_defines.name: Tin Ring
loot_defines.description: In the hands of an amazing wizard such as myself, even a simple ring can be powerful.

loot_defines.name: Shiny Iron Ring
loot_defines.description: It may not look like much - or be much, for that matter - but it's mine, so it's impressive.

loot_defines.name: Frosted Ring
loot_defines.description: Just a single touch can turn a man to ice. Or make them somewhat chilly, at least.

loot_defines.name: Frozen Ring of the Proven Wizard
loot_defines.description: Not that I have to prove myself to anyone.

loot_defines.name: Cracked Staff
loot_defines.description: Nothing a little ingenuity can't fix.

loot_defines.name: Glowing Staff
loot_defines.description: If your staff isn't glowing, you're not wizarding right.

loot_defines.name: Shining Staff
loot_defines.description: Shining like the statue of me in the Luskan harbour will be. Once I get my due.

loot_defines.name: Brilliant Staff of the Legendary Wizard
loot_defines.description: Are you sure 'legendary' is the right word? It seems too simple to me.

loot_defines.name: Dull Amulet
loot_defines.description: The Arcane Brotherhood's symbol should never be displayed so dimly.

loot_defines.name: Sparking Amulet
loot_defines.description: It's a little difficult to handle. Shocks you when you touch it.

loot_defines.name: Onyx Arcane Brotherhood Amulet
loot_defines.description: A wonderful symbol of the Brotherhood.

loot_defines.name: Master's Amulet of the Arcane Brotherhood
loot_defines.description: I certainly wouldn't want to assume a rank, but that sounds about right.

loot_defines.name: Cracked Scimitar
loot_defines.description: The first scimitar I used in my training with Zaknafein.

loot_defines.name: Sharp Scimitar
loot_defines.description: An instrument of death in the hands of an experienced drow warrior.

loot_defines.name: Frostbrand Scimitar
loot_defines.description: It pulses with a soft icy glow.

loot_defines.name: Icingdeath
loot_defines.description: Found in the treasure hoard of the white dragon Ingeloakastimizilian, better known as Icingdeath.

loot_defines.name: Dull Scimitar
loot_defines.description: A dull weapon suitable for training young Drow in the ways of battle.

loot_defines.name: Lithe Scimitar
loot_defines.description: A slender weapon; far more deadly than a bulky greatsword.

loot_defines.name: Defender Scimitar
loot_defines.description: An experienced warrior can use a sword for defense as well as offense.

loot_defines.name: Twinkle
loot_defines.description: Gifted to me by a Harpell of all people. One of the few sane ones.

loot_defines.name: Tattered Cloak
loot_defines.description: An apt metaphor for myself, if I'm being introspective.

loot_defines.name: Underdark Cloak
loot_defines.description: Allows you to blend in with the stony crags and otherworldly fungi of the Underdark.

loot_defines.name: Drow Ranger's Cloak
loot_defines.description: There was a time I would have been thrilled to receive this cloak. Now I use it because I must.

loot_defines.name: Hooded Cloak of the Faerûn Hero
loot_defines.description: Gifted to me by the Weeping Friars. Strange folk.

loot_defines.name: Flimsy Chest Piece
loot_defines.description: It would be better if you simply didn't get hit while wearing this.

loot_defines.name: Leather Chest Piece
loot_defines.description: A generic leather chest piece. Not much to note.

loot_defines.name: Drow Ranger's Chest Piece
loot_defines.description: Aids me in moving quickly and silently through most terrain.

loot_defines.name: Chest Piece of the Lost Homeland
loot_defines.description: I miss my homeland some days, but I don't miss the pain and strife that consumes that place.

loot_defines.name: Panther Toy
loot_defines.description: A children's play-thing.

loot_defines.name: Tin Statue
loot_defines.description: It has been painted black to resemble a more powerful artifact.

loot_defines.name: Onyx Figurine
loot_defines.description: Transforms into a black panther upon command. Not Guenhwyvar, though.

loot_defines.name: Figurine of Guenhwyvar
loot_defines.description: A unique figurine that summons my faithful companion, Guenhwyvar.

loot_defines.name: Steel Charm
loot_defines.description: An apprentice's replica of a far more powerful artifact.

loot_defines.name: Engraved Charm
loot_defines.description: A simple charm engraved with a unicorn motif.

loot_defines.name: Unicorn Necklace
loot_defines.description: Can be used to summon a faithful unicorn mount, if you are worthy.

loot_defines.name: Horn Charm of Mielikki
loot_defines.description: The ruling council of Silverymoon granted me Andarhar as gratitude for my service.

loot_defines.name: Cracked Hammer
loot_defines.description: Still sturdy enough to cause damage, if ye know what yer doin'.

loot_defines.name: Stout Hammer
loot_defines.description: A hammer's just a chunk o' iron 'til it's in the hands of a proper warrior.

loot_defines.name: Shining Hammer
loot_defines.description: The last thing me enemies see before Gorm takes 'em.

loot_defines.name: Golden Hammer of Clan Undurr
loot_defines.description: A beacon of hope for all who see its mighty swing. Enemies not included, of course.

loot_defines.name: Ratty Banner
loot_defines.description: A sad thing, but it's nice to have somethin' to follow.

loot_defines.name: Durable Banner
loot_defines.description: As durable as the Order of the Gauntlet itself.

loot_defines.name: Waving Banner
loot_defines.description: Brings a tear to me eye seein' it flap in the wind.

loot_defines.name: Order of the Gauntlet Banner
loot_defines.description: The Order is my home now. I shall follow them to the end o' time.

loot_defines.name: Dull Brass Symbol
loot_defines.description: Even the craggiest chunk of brass can have great meaning.

loot_defines.name: Dwarf-Forged Symbol
loot_defines.description: There was a time that I dinnae know what this symbol meant.

loot_defines.name: Symbol of Gorm
loot_defines.description: In me time of need, Gorm has been a shining beacon of hope.

loot_defines.name: Faithful Golden Amulet of Gorm
loot_defines.description: Gorm Gulthyn himself has chosen me as his emissary, of this I am sure.

loot_defines.name: Heavy Belt
loot_defines.description: Protects me waist and me legs! A little on the heavy side, though.

loot_defines.name: Iron Plated Belt
loot_defines.description: Yer gonna need a strong blow to get through this.

loot_defines.name: Gold Plated Belt
loot_defines.description: I was thinkin' one day, what haven't I plated in gold yet? Then I looked down.

loot_defines.name: Shining Belt of the Devout Cleric
loot_defines.description: It is my solemn duty to aid those in need and defend those who cannae defend themselves.

loot_defines.name: Steel Breastplate
loot_defines.description: I'm one tough dwarf to crack.

loot_defines.name: Ornate Breastplate
loot_defines.description: Ye can never have enough gold on yer armor, ye know.

loot_defines.name: Gemmed Breastplate
loot_defines.description: A masterfully crafted breastplate, if I ever saw one.

loot_defines.name: Bejewelled Breastplate of Dwarves
loot_defines.description: Perhaps a little over the top, yea, but if it causes just one enemy to pause, it's done its job.

loot_defines.name: Used Helmet
loot_defines.description: The old helm of my beloved, Storn Skulldark.

loot_defines.name: New Helmet
loot_defines.description: Granted to me by the Order of the Gauntlet when I joined their ranks.

loot_defines.name: Jewelled Helmet
loot_defines.description: Dinnae worry about me, it's reinforced with good dwarven steel.

loot_defines.name: Brilliant Helmet of the Order
loot_defines.description: Granted only to the Order's most devout and effective followers.

loot_defines.name: Dull Dagger
loot_defines.description: I prefer sneaking to stabbing, to be honest.

loot_defines.name: Chipped Dagger
loot_defines.description: This is what happens when you try to fight. Your nice things get chipped.

loot_defines.name: Halfling's Dagger
loot_defines.description: A solid dagger for a solid fellow, if I do say so myself.

loot_defines.name: Inscribed Dagger of the Hesitant Rogue
loot_defines.description: I'd rather not use this. It's quite nice and pristine.

loot_defines.name: Light Mace
loot_defines.description: It kind of... bends... when you swing it.

loot_defines.name: Dented Mace
